verses.verse: ((1 A prayer of the Church to obtain the favor of God and to be lightened with his countenance.2 To the end that his way and judgment may be known throughout the earth.7 And finally is declared the kingdom of God, which should be universally erected at the coming of Christ.) ) God be merciful unto us, and bless us, and cause his face to shine among us. (Selah.)
That (That both Jews and Gentiles may know Godâ€™s covenant made with them.) they may know thy way upon earth, and thy saving health among all nations.
Let the people praise thee, O God: let all the people praise thee.

(By these oft repetitions he showeth that the people can never rejoice sufficiently and give thanks for the great benefits that they shall receive under the kingdom of Christ.) Let the people be glad and rejoice: for thou shalt judge the people righteously, and govern the nations upon the earth. Selah.
Let the people praise thee, O God: let all the people praise thee.
Then shall (He showeth that where God favoreth, there shall be abundance of all other things.) the earth bring forth her increase, and God, even our God shall bless us.
God shall bless us, and all the ends of the earth (When they feel his great benefits both spiritual and corporal toward them.) shall fear him.
